page.title: 02THE WURLITZER ORGAN
page.content: Mr Rawle's{WurliTzer Organ}was built in{1927}when it cost{Â£37,000}.It came from the{Empire Cinema,Leicester {Square,London.}It is the largest cinema organ in Europe.The Rawles built their house around the organ,and they worked for{4 years.}It takes up half of their house and has{2,500} pipes which range in size from{1/2in. {to 17.5ft.}high,which is to the top of the house.It weighs{25 tons.}The roof space contains the{electric relays, {1,400 copper wires.}The house has{18 {inch}thick walls around the{pipe {chamber,}with{11 inches}of concrete in the roof.There are{4 keyboards}in the{ {console and 32 pedals.}It has many{ {instrumental effects}and can also sound like a church organ or a train. The{organ blower}is like a jet engine going backwards at{2,500revs/min.}It would cost{Â£300,000}to build today.
